bd9895024390e0a469487","dweb:/ipfs/QmPGWT2x3QHcKxqe6gRmAkdakhbaRgx3DLzcakHz5M4eXG"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Strings.sol":{"keccak256":"0xaf159a8b1923ad2a26d516089bceca9bdeaeacd04be50983ea00ba63070f08a3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6f2cf1c531122bc7ca96b8c8db6a60deae60441e5223065e792553d4849b5638","dweb:/ipfs/QmPBdJmBBABMDCfyDjCbdxgiqRavgiSL88SYPGibgbPas9"]}},"version":1}

params._l2BlockNumber: The L2 block number of the target block.

returns._0: L2 timestamp of the given block.

params._l2BlockTime: The time per L2 block, in seconds.
params._startingBlockNumber: The number of the first L2 block.
params._startingTimestamp: The timestamp of the first L2 block.
params._submissionInterval: Interval in blocks at which checkpoints must be submitted.

params._l2OutputIndex: Index of the first L2 output to be deleted. All outputs after this                       output will also be deleted.
Index of the output to return.

returns._0: The output at the given index.

params._l2BlockNumber: L2 block number to find a checkpoint for.

returns._0: First checkpoint that commits to the given L2 block number.

params._l2BlockNumber: L2 block number to find a checkpoint for.

returns._0: Index of the first checkpoint that commits to the given L2 block number.

params._startingBlockNumber: Block number for the first recorded L2 block.
params._startingTimestamp: Timestamp for the first recorded L2 block.

returns._0: The number of outputs that have been submitted.
The index of the next output to be submitted.

params._l1BlockHash: A block hash which must be included in the current chain.
params._l1BlockNumber: The block number with the specified block hash.
params._l2BlockNumber: The L2 block number that resulted in _outputRoot.
params._outputRoot: The L2 output of the checkpoint block.

returns._0: Semver contract version as a string.

params.l2BlockNumber: The L2 block number of the output root.
params.l2OutputIndex: The index of the output in the l2Outputs array.

params.newNextOutputIndex: Next L2 output index after the deletion.
params.prevNextOutputIndex: Next L2 output index before the deletion.

CHALLENGER().notice: The address of the challenger. Can be updated via upgrade.

FINALIZATION_PERIOD_SECONDS().notice: Minimum time (in seconds) that must elapse before a withdrawal can be finalized.

L2_BLOCK_TIME().notice: The time between L2 blocks in seconds. Once set, this value MUST NOT be modified.

SUBMISSION_INTERVAL().notice: The interval in L2 blocks at which checkpoints must be submitted. Although this is         immutable, it can safely be modified by upgrading the implementation contract.

VALIDATOR().notice: The address of the validator. Can be updated via upgrade.

computeL2Timestamp(uint256).notice: Returns the L2 timestamp corresponding to a given L2 block number.

deleteL2Outputs(uint256).notice: Deletes all checkpoint outputs after and including the output that corresponds to         the given output index. Only the challenger address can delete outputs.

getL2Output(uint256).notice: Returns an output by index. Exists because Solidity's array access will return a         tuple instead of a struct.

getL2OutputAfter(uint256).notice: Returns the L2 checkpoint output that checkpoints a given L2 block number. Uses a         binary search to find the first output greater than or equal to the given block.

getL2OutputIndexAfter(uint256).notice: Returns the index of the L2 output that checkpoints a given L2 block number. Uses a         binary search to find the first output greater than or equal to the given block.

latestBlockNumber().notice: Returns the block number of the latest submitted L2 checkpoint output. If no outputs         have been submitted yet then this function will return the starting block number.

latestOutputIndex().notice: Returns the number of outputs that have been submitted. Will revert if no outputs         have been submitted yet.

nextBlockNumber().notice: Computes the block number of the next L2 block that needs to be checkpointed.

nextOutputIndex().notice: Returns the index of the next output to be submitted.

startingBlockNumber().notice: The number of the first L2 block recorded in this contract.

startingTimestamp().notice: The timestamp of the first L2 block recorded in this contract.

submitL2Output(bytes32,uint256,bytes32,u.notice: Accepts an outputRoot and the timestamp of the corresponding L2 block. The timestamp         must be equal to the current value returned by `nextTimestamp()` in order to be         accepted. This function may only be called by the Validator.

version().notice: Returns the full semver contract version.

OutputSubmitted(bytes32,uint256,uint256,.notice: Emitted when an output is submitted.

userdoc.notice: The L2OutputOracle contains an array of L2 state outputs, where each output is a         commitment to the state of the L2 chain. Other contracts like the KromaPortal use         these outputs to verify information about the state of L2.
